detailsOfAchievement: Key Education Foundation works with affordable private schools and government schools in low income communities and delivers the School Readiness Program. This program ensures quality in delivery of early childhood education through collective action of all the stakeholders involved i.e. the child, the teacher and the parent. In the past year, we have implemented the School Readiness Program in 50 Affordable private schools benefiting 180 teachers, 5000 children and their families.

sourceOfFunds.purpose: Key Education Foundation is an NGO focused on improving quality of Early Childhood Education for children from less privileged and low income communities. During the past 3 years, we have positively impacted the lives of 6000 children, their Parents and 250 Teachers in 60 low fees Private Schools. Our operations are supported through financial grants from grant making institutions such as Central Square Foundation, Wipro Applying Thought in Education, CSR initiatives from HP, MindTeck, HNI,etc

detailsOfAchievement: Our Asias Second largest lake Shantisagara OR Sulekere which is located in channagiri Taluk, Davanagere District, Karnataka, India is about to die because of illegal encroachment and 70 Percent of the lake is filled with Shilt. Khadga Sangha is a group of working professionals working towards in protecting our lake from last 1 year. visited more than 110 villages, conducted students rallys, pilgrimage on foot, to make awareness about the lake.

sourceOfFunds.purpose: Khadga Sangha is a group of Working Professionals Software Engineers,Doctors,Teachers,Farmers,Others we started our activity in 2008 to protect our environment, to help financially week students, conducted medical camps in villages, planting trees on road side etc. Khadga Sangha was re structured and Re Registered on State wise in 2018, our main agenda is protecting our Lakes,Rivers,Forests,Employment Awareness etc. Currently we are working in protecting our Asias Second Largest Lake.

detailsOfAchievement: About Organisation Kids Â® was established in 2001-02. We focus on eco friendly life styles, medicinal plant and address climate change regionally. Parisara Mitra School (eco friendly schools): the objective of the programme is learning, understand, educate and disseminate the knowledge of natural resources in a sustainable way. Literacy on Air, Water, Soil, Energy, Health Hygiene & Teaching Learning methodologies. Parisara mitra school programme (environmental literacy) was initiated from KIDS 2007-08 with in a district identifying 21 schools every year and honouring with cash award and citation. Latter KSPCB appreciated our work and disseminated to the entire 34 educational district in Karnataka and recognizing 714 schools as parisara mitra with a plan to move this message to go green and sustainable life style activities. Environmental literacy: We are conducting the day camps and residential camps throughout the year. The camps are school level, district level, state level and National Level. detailsOfAchievement: Kinnara Mela is a Cultural organization established in 1990 at Tumari atiny village in karnataka state. Devoting mainly for theatre activities the organization sratrted with agroup of adult actors performing for children.Later the organization extended its activities with several projects and programmes with the aim of of developing childrens personolity through theatre medium. Following are the major regular activities of the organization. Kinnara Mela Theatre company every year prepare 2 productions and perform 120-150 shows at schools and colleges. title: KOSHIKA
detailsOfAchievement: KOSHIKA(R) (Kota Shivaram Karanth) Cultural organization dedicated to children theatre Started in the year 1998 based in cherkadi village, 20 km away from central Udupi. The organisations main objective is to foster theatre-in-education, a model now gaining widespread popularity across the world, through working with children of a range of age groups and backgrounds. The Organization aims at spreading education through the medium of theatre through means such as performances that juxtapose modern issues with traditional forms of presentation, workshops and discussions. The company has been concerned with spreading education through theatre and devising performances for children for many years through activities such as organizing educational programs in school, creating plays with children and conducting workshops. With over 150 interactive theatre performances since from 15 years Koshika helped hundreds of childrens to discover themselves and being confident to showcase themselves. Most important program of Koshika is organising summer camps called Vasantha shibira every year. The children from various villages around Cherkadi participate in this one month long camp. The organization collects no fee from the participants nor any financial aid from government along with providing a free afternoon meal. Educating village community against superstition, alcohol and scholarships to poor students are Koshikas other activities. Koshika perform more than 20 shows in a year on an average and reach out to more than 4000 audiences beyond the boundaries of age, financial and social status in the states like Karnataka, Kerala and Tamilnadu. Our experiments in theatre have received overwhelming responses from theatre lovers and critics alike.

title: KUSUMA KALA SANGHA
detailsOfAchievement: KUSUMA KALA SANGHA is located in a remote village, which is at a distance of just twenty three kilometers from Taluk Head Quarters namely Gubbi, the latter is a big and non-erasable name in history of Kannada Theatre, especially in Parsi Company style traditions. The inception of this cultural idiom i.e. KUSUMA KALA SANGHA emerged out of real zeal pertaining to protect and develop the rural aesthetic cense of Performing Arts. KUSUMA KALA SANGHA has "been working with the aforesaid motto since 1996 with multi-facet programmes namely proscenium performances, street-plays, children performances, sponsored perfoÂ¬rmance of high repute, besides our regular modern theatre perforÂ¬mances inevitably such as proto .literacy movement, environment movement, anti-dowry movement etc.50th Independence Day got celebrated throughout the District with special attention to enrich the patriotism among rural-folks, youngsters and children. SUGGI SAMSKRUTHIKA UTSAV and also titled SUGGI RANGA SAMBRAMA is also significant regular programme and turned into mass-appraised and District of annual in nature, has got a cultural demand in the We are proud of giving coastal YAKSHAGANA performances to our audience and also the unique performances of HAADIYAATA, Directed by an alumni of Nat ional School of Drama, New Delhi, who. also happens to be Aesthetic Adviser of us. We are with the feather of recognisation of the Department of Culture, Government of India through the Salary grant given to the Professional organisation under of Financial Assistance to the Cultural Orqanisations. Besides to our regular performance we are giving Street-Plays throughout the District and collecting contribution from village-folk, so as to handover the purse with an amount of Rs.10,000 to the Deputy Commissioner of Tumkur District for the GUJARAT EARTHQUAKE RELIEF FUND. We are accredited with resource personalities from every walk of theatre-culture namely Sri.V.Rama Murthy, Sri.K.V. Karanth, Sri.Nairy and others from National School of Drama: Sri.H.V. Venkata Subbaiah, Sri Tumkur Shiva Kumar,Prof. K.V. Rajagopal, Dr.J.S.Murthy, Sri. Channabasaiah Gubbi and other awardees of Kannada Nataka ACademy: Sri.Mahalingu, Sri Mysore Ramanand, Smt.Renuka Bali Udaya Kumar, Sri.Yakshadegula Mohan, Sri Kote Nagabhushan and other renowned Theatre expertisers. We are from the theatre urge and committed and deeply involved to the field of Theatre by the performances of Theatre programmes.

detailsOfAchievement: Started its activities in 2004. It has organized more than 200 concerts of both Carnatic and Hindusthani Music. It has published a unique calender in 2011 having the photos of reputed and promising artistes of this region. Smrti Ranjani - a commomerate volume was published in 2014 in memory of Late Smt Ranjani Hebbar, well known Carnatic Musician. Every year conducting music workshops. From last 6 years organizing RAGA SUDHA RASA, National Music Festival in the month of January. Yuva Kalamani Award has been presented every year to promising artistes with cash of 25,000 Rs. Senior musicians and dance performers are also felicitated. This is considered as the only organization which is organizing both Hindusthani and Carnatic music in this region. Nadanubandha - a unique series of ten programmes conducted in different parts of coastal Karnataka. Griha Kutcheri - music concerts in different houses. Organized concerts in rural areas to educate the people. Published several CDs of Carnatic Music like Swara Sukha, Krishna Prarthana, Nadaswaram etc.
